content.full_text:
Resolution regarding Publishing the State Laws in Newspapers, 1 Resolved, that the committee on public accounts and expenditures, be instructed to

enquire into the expediency of authorizeing the publishing of the State laws, of a

general nature, in the public Newspapers, and, that they report by bill or otherwise.
paragraphs: Resolution regarding Publishing the State Laws in Newspapers, 1 Resolved, that the committee on public accounts and expenditures, be instructed to
enquire into the expediency of authorizeing the publishing of the State laws, of a
general nature, in the public Newspapers, and, that they report by bill or otherwise.

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincolnwrote and introduced this resolution in theHouse of Representativeson December 26, 1835, and the House adopted it.  On December 31, the Committee on
                  Public Accounts and Expenditures, of which Lincoln was a member,  issued areportrecommending against legislation on the subject.Illinois HouseJournal. 1835.  9th G. A., 2nd sess., 158-59, 186.

structured_content.text: Resolution regarding Publishing the State Laws in Newspapers, [26 December 1835]1

Resolved, that the committee on public accounts and expenditures, be instructed to
               enquire into the expediency of authorizeing the publishing of the State laws, of a
               general nature, in the public Newspapers, and, that they report by bill or otherwise.
